div.div: Modelling results for local recruitment of great tits.
div.p: Modelling results for local recruitment of the great tit ( Parus major) survival examining the effects of centred hatching date (HD) and synchrony (SYN). Models also include PK = peak height in caterpillar food abundance, DC = distance to the center of the study area, MASS = mass, DEN = density, + additive effects, *interaction and variable name2 = quadratic effect of the variable, k = number of parameters. QAIC is scaled with Ä‰ = 1.137. Model parameters for survival include the intercept and age, and for recapture rates the intercept, but model names include only the covariates to increase readability.
